background: A factory needs to provide transportation for its employees using a mix of taxis and company cars, taking into account the capacities of each and specific limits on company car usage.
constraints: Each taxi ride can carry up to TaxiCapacity employees
Each company car ride can carry up to CarCapacity employees
At most MaxCarRideProportion of the rides can be company car rides
There must be at least MinCarRides of company car rides
There must be enough rides to transport at least MinEmployees employees
Number of taxi rides is non-negative
Number of company car rides is non-negative
objective: Minimize the total number of taxi rides
description: A factory provides rides for its employees in either taxis or company cars. Each taxi ride can take \param{TaxiCapacity} employees while each company car ride can take \param{CarCapacity} employees. Since buying and maintaining cars is expensive, at most \param{MaxCarRideProportion} of the rides can be company car rides. However, there has to be at least \param{MinCarRides} company car rides. If the company needs to transport at least \param{MinEmployees} employees, how many rides of each should be done to minimize the total number of taxi rides.

parameters.definition: Number of employees that a taxi ride can take
Number of employees that a company car ride can take
Maximum proportion of the total rides that can be company car rides
Minimum number of company car rides
Minimum number of employees to be transported
